residential.headline: Environmentally Green at " the Fair ".
residential.description:
Lovers of modern styling and low-maintenance living will adore this divine three bedroom terrace home hugging Canberra's established inner north, close to the surrounding mountain bike areas and walking tracks.
This cleverly laid-out lifestyle property is roughly 4 years old and has a property depreciation schedule completed by the current owners for the years ahead; year 3 depreciation here for example was $9,503.00.
The interior is equally impressive, with a captivating entry opening up light-filled interiors that are divided into downstairs living areas and upstairs sleeping quarters. On the lower level the pristine presentation includes quality carpeting, unobtrusive electric heating for warmth on those cold Winter mornings and reverse cycle cooling when you need a cool environment. These gorgeous living areas also open out to a private, enclosed courtyard that's bound to inspire al fresco dining and Summer soirees.
The positioning of this quality property was a significant factor when the current owner purchased it. Sitting adjacent to manicured community gardens, it gives a sense of individuality and extra space that will be both appreciated and desirable.
A staircase leads up to the evening accommodation, where you'll find a master bedroom overlooking and two family bedrooms, all of which include built-in robes.
The beautiful finishes and quality fixtures are the other features likely to leave a strong impression. Bosch appliances, an integrated dishwasher and an open plan kitchen with plenty of storage and preparation space is perfect for those that love cooking and the adjacent dining room will keep the chef involved in the conversation throughout the meal.
This community title property presents extrordinary value for buyers - roughly 8 kilometres from the city, only minutes away from Gungahlin and Dickson and a surprisingly short drive to the airport, it also enjoys the convenience of local schools, parklands and Watson's local shopping centre.
Three spacious bedrooms with built-in-robes Large master bedroom Convection radiators and reverse cycle airconditioning Additional powder room on lower level A generous and private courtyard with established gardens Family room/meals area off kitchen Modern kitchen with Bosch stainless steel appliances Stainless steel dishwasher Abundance of cupboard and storage space Internal laundry Open plan design Single garage with separate street access Energy efficient solar gas hot water system Walking distance to local schools, Watson shops, walking trails, playing fields, reserves and Mount Majura Easy walk to EPIC, Farmers Markets and transport Administration and sinking funds are $2889,60 pa.
